page.title: 16A DAY IN THE LIFE OF ...
page.content: Hopeful of at least one dry day I went for a walk up Whernside, a 'hill' near Settle, one of the{'Three Peaks'. We got up at about 7.10. I had my breakfast, and packed my rucksack with lunch, a bottle of water, and some useful clothes. We met our friends for the walk, a family from Hull, at Horton in Ribblesdale, at about 11.10am. We set off soon afterwards, and walked a steady six miles uphill before we ate our sandwiches by a waterfall. After setting off again, we traversed the summit through mud and bog before descending the opposite face. We then crossed some fields before rejoining our original path under the famous Ribblehead viaduct. We travelled back to the cars, and set off home. On arrival, we fed the dog, and I climbed into bed to listen to 'Into the Music' on Radio 1.
